This disguise makes you—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look like a specific Humanoid chosen by the jacket's creator when it was enchanted.

The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if the disguise adds a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.
To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the {@action Study|XPHB} action to inspect your appearance and succeed on a DC 14 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check.

item.name: Painter's Sun Hat
entries: This well-made hat can come in any shape, size, or form and, upon casual inspection, seems to be mundane in nature. However, when the hat is placed on the ground as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and its command word is spoken, it begins to float into the air. The hovering hat then produces an image of a Humanoid of your choice that you are familiar with, though the Humanoid is always depicted wearing the hat.
The image can't move, and it remains until the hat is moved out of place, or until the creature that activated it speaks the command word again, causing the hat to float back to the ground.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it. A creature that takes a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful DC 10 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image

item.name: Pendants of Belonging
entries: These pendants come in sets of four, six, or eight. While wearing one of the pendants, a creature always knows the direction of the other pendants in that set.

item.name: Punch Card
entries: This old punch card from a long-forgotten tea shop somehow holds a unique enchantment, which punches a hole in the card every time the creature carrying it is hit by an attack. A hole can't be punched in the card by any means other than this enchantment. When found, the card has {@dice 1d6} punches already in it. When the tenth and final hole is punched in the card, the magic is released, reducing the incoming attack's damage to 0. The card's magic then fades.

item.name: Roake's Clay Urn
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can present this clay urn and speak a handful of ritualistic phrases unique to it. One Spirit of your choice that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is pulled into the clay urn and sealed away. If the Spirit has a {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} of 3 or higher, it automatically succeeds on the save.

While the Spirit is sealed inside, it is in a state of suspended animation; it has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition (even if it would normally have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to that condition), doesn't age, and doesn't need food, water, or air. It also doesn't suffer from any effects on it (including poisons and curses). The Spirit is released when the urn's seal is broken or the urn is destroyed, at which point the Spirit reappears in the nearest unoccupied space to the urn, waking up as if no time had passed.
Roake's Clay Urn can only contain one Spirit. Once that Spirit is released, the urn becomes nonmagical.

item.name: Ruby Red Bike
entries: This bicycle has a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 70 feet. After using this bicycle to move at least 60 feet on your turn, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to produce a fiery wall along the path you took, as if from the {@spell Wall of Fire|XPHB} spell. Once this property of the bicycle has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Scarf of Muffling
entries: This soft and well-loved scarf wraps snugly around the wearer's neck, making anyone who wears it feel extra cozy. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can throw the scarf at a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or the scarf magically wraps around its mouth, preventing it from speaking. A creature can use its action to make a DC 14 Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check, removing the scarf from itself or another creature within its reach on a success. This property of the scarf can be used three times, and it regains all expended uses daily at dawn.

item.name: Scuttling Lantern
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch the Scuttling Lantern to activate it (causing it to shed {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 30-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 30 feet) or deactivate it (snuffing out the light). While the lantern is lit, if you are the one who activated it, you can command it to move once on each of your turns (no action required). When you do so, the lantern moves up to 20 feet in a direction of your choice along a solid surface (such as a wall, ceiling, or floor) or through water. It deactivates if it is ever more than 500 feet away from you. If you command the lantern to follow you, it remains within 10 feet of you, provided no obstacles impede its path.

item.name: Sibling Purses
entries: These two sibling coin pouches open up 5 inches wide and can hold up to 5 pounds each. When you place an object into one of the pouches and the other pouch is within 20 feet of it, you can cause the object to teleport into the other pouch, provided there is room to accommodate the object.

item.name: Soda Cans
entries: There are a number of these strange beverages on the island, and only those brave enough to drink them know their magical effects:

items.name: Melon Soda
items.entry: This beverage grants the effect of 1 random common Combat potion.

items.name: Cola Soda
items.entry: This beverage grants the effect of 1 random common Utility potion.

items.name: Fish Sauce Soda
items.entry: This beverage grants the effect of 1 random common Whimsical potion.

item.name: Solar Amulet
entries: Whenever you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} from a spell or magical effect while wearing this amulet, you regain an extra 3 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

item.name: Sticky Hand
entries: While holding this children's toy in one hand, you can cast the Retrieve cantrip.

item.name: Sunbaked Cassettes
entries: This sun-damaged cassette is beginning to lose hold of the magic stored inside it. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can hold the cassette out in front of you in an attempt to draw out its power. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a roll of 3 or lower, you regain an expended spell slot of a level equal to the number rolled (if you don't have any expended spell slots of that level, you instead regain a spell slot of the next-highest level that you have expended). On a roll of 4, you teleport 30 feet in a random direction. Once you regain a spell slot in this way, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Talisman of the Phoenix
entries: This talisman has {@dice 1d4} charges. Whenever you fail a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} while the talisman is on your person, you can choose to expend a charge to succeed instead. Once all of the talisman's charges have been used, it burns up in a flash, leaving behind a pile of ashes. It then reforms with {@dice 1d4} charges somewhere else on the same plane of existence.

item.name: Yappa Mask
entries: While wearing the Yappa Mask, your creature type is Spirit. In addition, you know Torum, the Spirit language.

item.name: A New Look
entries: When imbibed, this unassuming elixir transforms your head into a random anthropomorphic animal, such as a horse, panda, pig, or raccoon. The effects of this potion are Permanent, unless removed by a spell of level 5 or higher as if it were a curse.
{@font {@style 45|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Rabbit's Speed
entries: Within seconds of downing this potion, you feel a distinct lightness and spring in your step. Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 5 feet for the next 10 minutes.
{@font {@style 1|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Weapon Master's Elixir
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain a sense of clarity and focus. The swing of a certain weapon becomes second nature to you. For the next 24 hours, you have proficiency with a Melee weapon of your choice.
{@font {@style 2|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Spirit of Salyri
entries: This potion is said to contain the spirit of Salyri, a great Obojiman warrior known for her fighting prowess. Anyone who drinks this potion gains a certain understanding of how to effectively wear armor in combat. For the next 24 hours, you have training with {@item Shield|XPHB|Shields} or one type of armor of your choice.
{@font {@style 3|large}|SneakerProMedium}

language.name: Naku Naku
entries: Most Nakudama continue to speak their original language as well as the common tongue, and they claim theirs is far richer for the telling of tales.
This weapon is crafted with strands of moonlight. At night, attacks with it deal an extra {@damage 1d8} Radiant damage on a hit.

This magical bow can split arrows as you fire it, allowing you to target two creatures within 10 feet of each other. When you use the bow in this way, you make only one attack roll, which applies to both targets. If the attack hits at least one of the targets, roll damage normally. A target hit by a split arrow takes half the amount of damage rolled (round down).

A creature in possession of both the Lunar Weapon and the Solar Amulet can perform a 1-hour ritual to combine those items, forming the Weapon of the Sun and Moon. This weapon retains the properties of the Lunar Weapon and grants you the benefits of the Solar Amulet while holding it.

In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while holding the Weapon of the Sun and Moon, you can activate its Eclipse Power. Doing so during the day casts the {@spell Darkness|XPHB} spell; this version of the spell causes the darkness to fill a 60-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} or a 60-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, instead of its normal size. Doing so during the night, casts the {@spell Daylight|XPHB} spell. Once the daytime Eclipse Power is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn; once the nighttime Eclipse Power is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

trait.name: Like the Wind
entries: The Wild Spirit can move through other creatures' spaces as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.

trait.name: Promising Threat
entries: The Wild Spirit has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|XPHB}) checks if the target has seen it hit a creature with its Chomp attack in the past minute

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit spell attack modifier} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage,and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} if it is Large or smaller.

reaction.name: Thought Shield
entries: {@actTrigger} The Wild Spirit reduces a creature to o {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. {@actResponse} The Wild Spirit regains {@dice 1d10} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} (same as above), {@item Book|XPHB} (research), 5 Candles, {@item Shovel|XPHB}, {@item Signal Whistle|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 6 GP; or (B) 50 GP

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Spear|XPHB}, {@item Navigator's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Chest|XPHB}, {@item Grappling Hook|XPHB}, 2 {@item Pouch|XPHB|Pouches}, {@item Rope|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 13 GP; or (B) 50 GP

backgroundFluff.name: Apprentice of AHA
entries: You spent time studying with the archaeologists, historians, and archivists of AHA, a group of adventuring academics who seek knowledge about the nature of Obojima and its past. With your mentor, you pursued answers to one of the island's many mysteries. During your apprenticeship, you traveled to one or more of AHA's excavation sites and worked alongside the organization, but never became an official member. Even now, unanswered questions from your time with the group continue to rattle around in your mind. For more on AHA, see page 21.

backgroundFluff.name: Apprentice Diver
entries: You are, or once were, a member of the Mariners' Guild, an intrepid group of aquatic explorers and mariners. Working as an apprentice diver in the lodge, you have learned much about the Shallows—you know what is dangerous and what is delicious. You have climbed the cliffs around the island, explored many beaches, swam in the waters, and learned how to use the gear needed to survive under the waves. For more on the Mariners' Guild, see page 21.

feat.name: Cloud Hopper
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Haze
entries: You always have the {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast it in this way, you can't cast the spell in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell's spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

entries.name: Nimbus Step
entries: When you move on your turn, you can choose to conjure tiny clouds below your feet, allowing you to move into unoccupied spaces in the air. You can move a number of feet in this way equal to 5 x your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} before the clouds stop appearing. Ending this movement while in the air causes you to fall as normal.

feat.name: Boomerang Expert
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Enhanced Boomerangs
entries: The {@item Boomerang|ObojimaTallGrass24|Boomerang's} damage die becomes a {@dice d8} for you.

entries.name: Instinctive Catch
entries: You automatically catch the {@item Boomerang|ObojimaTallGrass24} after throwing it, without needing to use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

entries.name: Long Throws
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with Boomerangs.

feat.name: Bubling Fool
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Fool Points
entries: You have a number of Fool Points equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and can spend the points on the benefit below. You regain your expended Fool Points when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Replace Roll
entries: When you fail a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} and roll a number on the die equal to half your character level (round up) or lower, you can choose to replace the die roll with a 15 instead.

feat.name: Canden & Moon's Master Cut

prerequisite.other: Trained at Masters Canden and Moon's Sword School

entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Parrying Blade
entries: When you're hit by an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to assume a defensive stance, allowing you to fend off incoming strikes. You have a +5 bonus to AC against the triggering attack. You can assume this stance a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Vigilant
entries: Immediately after rolling {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} before the first turn of combat to draw a weapon and move up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

feat.name: Coven Witch
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Coven Magic
entries: Choose two level 1 spells from the Conjuration, Divination, or Transmutation school of magic. You always have those spells prepared. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either spell in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

entries.name: Witch's Brew
entries: You learn two random common and uncommon potion recipes from your coven.

feat.name: Forager
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Scrounge
entries: You produce twice the number of common or uncommon ingredients when foraging.

entries.name: Survivalist
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Survival|XPHB} skill. If you already have proficiency in it, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in it.

feat.name: Freediver
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold damage.

entries.name: Deep Breath
entries: You triple your Constitution modifier when calculating how long you can hold your breath.

entries.name: Swimmer
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to twice your Constitution score (round up to the nearest 5 feet). If you already have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB}, it instead increases by 10 feet.

feat.name: Group Combatant
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Damage Reduction
entries: When you're hit by an attack roll while you're not wearing Heavy armor, any Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage dealt to you by that attack is reduced by 2.

entries.name: Situational Awarenessn
entries: After you provoke an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} on your turn, your movement doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} for the rest of the turn.

feat.name: Light Foot
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Adroit
entries: Whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can forgo one of your attacks to move up to half your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Nimble
entries: You can move through the space of any creature, regardless of its size, but you can't stop in the same space.

entries.name: Surefooted
entries: Nonmagical {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} costs you no extra movement.

feat.name: Magically Mischievous
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Conceal
entries: When you succeed on a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB}) check to steal something, you can magically turn the object you stole {@condition Invisible|XPHB} as part of the same action, as if you had cast the {@spell Obscure Object|ObojimaTallGrass24} spell. The object must be small enough to fit in the palm of your hand, and this effect lasts for 1 minute. You can use this effect a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Deft Hands
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB} skill. If you already have proficiency in it, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in it.

feat.name: Member of AHA
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Shared Research
entries: You know the {@spell Jolt|ObojimaTallGrass24} cantrip. In addition, choose one of the following spells: {@spell Comprehend Languages|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Identify|XPHB}, or {@spell Illusory Script|XPHB}. You always have that spell prepared, and you can cast it without expending a spell slot. Once you cast that spell in this way, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Minor Corruption
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Corrupted Casting
entries: You don't need to use a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, allowing you to cast them without Material components, unless they are consumed by the spell or have a cost specified in it.

entries.name: Delay Wounds
entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you take damage, you can temporarily negate an amount of the damage equal to 3 times your character level; you take any excess damage as normal. At the end of your next turn, you must make a Constitution saving throw, the DC of which equals 10 or one-third the damage you would have taken (round down), whichever number is higher. On a failed save, you immediately take the negated damage. You must continue to make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of your turns for 1 minute or until you fail the save, at which point you take the negated damage. Once you take this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Nakudama's Electric Bloodline
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Galvanic Tongue
entries: You have an electrified tongue that you can use to make Unarmed Strikes. It has the Finesse and Reach properties, and when you hit with it, the strike deals Lightning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier, instead of dealing the normal damage for your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. The damage from your tongue increases when you reach character level 5 ({@dice 1d8}), 11 ({@dice 1d10}), and 17 ({@dice 1d12}).

entries.name: Static Skin
entries: When you gain the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force the grappler to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} Lightning damage and the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition ends. Once you use this effect, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. If the creature succeeds on the save, your use of Static Skin isn't expended.

feat.name: Nakudama's Toxin Bloodline
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Poisoned Resilience
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Toxin Bullet
entries: As an Attack action, you can spit several globs of poison in quick succession, targeting a number of creatures within 30 feet of you equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. Each target makes a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). A target takes Poison damage equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

feat.name: Postal Knight
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Survivalist
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Survival|XPHB} skill. If you already have proficiency in it, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in it.

entries.name: Reduced Exhaustion Penalties
entries: When you make a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, the roll is reduced by 1 times your {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level, instead of 2.

entries.name: Tireless
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} isn't reduced by {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}.

feat.name: Potion Brewer
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Advanced Alchemy
entries: When brewing potions, you can choose to take the second-highest ingredient attribute number from your potion recipe, instead of the highest.

entries.name: Double Batch
entries: When brewing a potion, you can roll percentile dice. If you roll a number equal to or lower than your character level, you create two potions instead of ones.

feat.name: Tellu & Scale's Master Cut

prerequisite.other: Trained at Masters Tellu and Scale's Sword School

entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: One Handed
entries: While wielding a {@itemProperty V|XPHB|Versatile} weapon in one hand, your quick movements and agile defense allow you to regain ground even when your enemy advances. Once before the start of your next turn when an enemy within your reach makes a melee attack roll against you and misses, the attacker takes damage of your weapon's type equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entries.name: Two Handed
entries: When wielding a {@itemProperty V|XPHB|Versatile} weapon in two hands, your powerful stance allows you to catch your target off guard. Whenever an enemy within your reach makes a melee attack roll against you and misses, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to attempt to knock the attacker off balance. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or gain the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

feat.name: Toraf & Bolder's Master Cut

prerequisite.other: Trained at Masters Toraf and Bolder's Sword School

entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Targeted Strikes
entries: Before you make a melee attack roll using a weapon you're proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the roll. If the attack hits, the target is subjected to one of the effects of your choice below. You can use a Targeted Strike only once per turn.

items.name: Head Strike
items.entry: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

items.name: Leg Strike
items.entry: The target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced by 10 feet (to a minimum {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 10 feet). This effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Torso Strike
items.entry: The target can't speak until the start of your next turn, after which it is immune to the effects of Torso Strike for the next minute.

feat.name: Vocalist Arcanist
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Crescendo
entries: When you cast a spell that forces a target to make a saving throw or requires you to make an attack roll, you can choose to enhance the spell through song. You can wait until after you roll the {@dice d20} before deciding to use this, but must decide before the GM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. When you do so, make a Charisma ({@skill Performance|XPHB}) check. The DC for this check is equal to 10 plus the spell's level. On a success, your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} for the attack roll or your save DC for that casting of the spell is doubled. Once you have succeeded on this check three times, you can't use this benefit again until the next dawn.

feat.name: Wetland Explorer
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Marsh Menace
entries: Select two creature types of your choice. Whenever you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} at the start of a combat that has one or more enemies of the chosen types, you can add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to the roll. For the purposes of this benefit, a creature that has magically altered its form counts as the type it appears as, rather than its true creature type.

entries.name: Swamp Tracker
entries: You gain a +5 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) checks when trying to hide from or track a creature of one of the chosen types.

skill.name: Mechanics
entries: Your Intelligence (Mechanics) check measures your ability to comprehend, operate, craft, and repair non-magical machines.

skill.name: Salvage
entries: The GM might ask you to make an Intelligence (Salvage) check to search for, disassemble, or otherwise recall information about mechanical parts that are useful for magical and non-magical machines or potions.

condition.name: Pacified
entries: A pacified creature can't attack, cast a spell that affects an enemy, or deal damage to another creature.
